content.question: Note: Figure not drawn to scale. The shaded regions R1 and R2 shown above are enclosed by the graphs of f(x) = x2 and g(x) = 2x. (a) Find the x- and y-coordinates of the three points of intersection of the graphs of f and g.

frqParts.text: Note: Figure not drawn to scale. The shaded regions R1 and R2 shown above are enclosed by the graphs of f(x) = x2 and g(x) = 2x. (a) Find the x- and y-coordinates of the three points of intersection of the graphs of f and g.
(b) Without using absolute value, set up an expression involving one or more integrals that gives the total area enclosed by the graphs of f and g. Do not evaluate.

(c) Without using absolute value, set up an expression involving one or more integrals that gives the volume of the solid generated by revolving the region R 1 about the line y  =  5 . Do not evaluate.

topic.text: 8.4: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of x

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
